alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 1:17AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following counties, Chelan and western Okanogan. * WHEN...From 1 PM PDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other flood-prone locations like burn scars. Some of the burned areas included in the Flash Flood Watch are the Red Apple, 25 Mile, Cedar Creek, Cub Creek, and Muckamuck burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered slow moving thunderstorms will develop over Chelan and western portions of Okanogan counties this afternoon and early this evening. Storms will be capable of producing heavy rain quickly over steep terrain. Runoff will be capable of producing rapid rises on creeks as well as producing rock and mud slides. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
